title: PLEASE restore classic behaviour of SAVE and QUIT
content:
There is a real need to restore the classic behaviour of firefox on closing, i mean: closing firefox -> prompt asking [save and quit] [quit] [cancel] then the behaviour: save and quit -> save open tabs and reopen them at next firefox startup quit -> close fierfox and delete current session, fresh firefox session at next startup it was also possible to enable it by the "showQuitWarning" in about:config

At the actual status you can only choose between:

always reopen previous session  : so when you close firefox with 20 open tabs that you dont need anymore you will find all them open again when you reopen firefox and then you have to close them one by one or manually start a new session

or

do not reopen previous session : so when you close firefox and you have some open tabs you must remeber to manually restore previous session on next startup because otherwise you will lose those tabs

So, why don't just reintroduce the classic behaviour and let the user choose what's better? Seems legit for a browser said to be open

Try to ask users if more feedback are needed

title: Firefox on Mac auto-raises windows on focus
content:
I am using Firefox 86 on MacOS 10.15.7. I also use Yabai to enable "sloppy focus" behavior. This means any window that the mouse moves over is given focus, but is not automatically raised on top of other windows.

Firefox appears to automatically raise its windows any time they receive focus. This is undesirable if I have several windows open on one screen and they overlap each other to some degree. Moving the mouse across the screen pops up each window up to the top of the stack as the mouse passes over them (because Yabai gives each one focus as the mouse passes over it). Note that I am not clicking on anything, just moving the mouse across the screen.

Most Mac applications do not do this. Is there a way to turn off this behavior in Firefox?

title: YouTube misdirecting to wrong videos, channels etc.. when clicked only on FireFox
content:
Hello,

I have been having this problem for a long while and have finally gotten annoyed enough to start trying to fix it but don't know where to start. Please feel free to be very technical with me because I am a help desk analyst in the corp. sector with25 years experience.

This problem only happens in FireFox; it does not happen in Google Chrome and I don't use any of the MS browsers or any other browsers. This problem also does not happen on my Apple devices nor on either of my 2 Samsung Smart TVs. This only happens on YouTube (YT) in FF and not on any other web site.

When I click on things in YT it routinely takes me to the incorrect linked item/location/video. It has gotten so bad that I am using Chrome more than FF for YT which is annoying because most of my saved bookmarks/links are saved and up to date in FF not Chrome because I got fed up with Chrome taking too many system resources up. I have already cleared my cookies and cache and disabled extensions but it still doesn't fix the problem. I don't want to just willy nilly blow away my YT history and I don't believe that the problem is with my YT history on YT's/Google's servers because if it was then it would be happening on other browsers and other devices, which as stated it is not. Essentially in a nutshell click on "A" and I get "Z" or "W" or "N" but never get to the "A".

I would like to reserve uninstalling FF and reinstalling it as a no choice last resort option because I have certain things saved that I don't want to have to attempt to rebuild. I keep FF updated.

All suggestions appreciated. I have provided the troubleshooting data from FF below.

Sincerely,


Amazon Princess Diana
creator: AmazonPrincessDiana
